thread.title: Pacquiao vs Khan fight is off, says Arum
thread.title_full: Pacquiao vs Khan fight is off, says Arum

title: Pacquiao vs Khan fight is off, says Arum
text:
Pacquiao vs Khan fight is off, says Arum By Dino Maragay (philstar.com)   9:53am The reported deal for Manny Pacquiao to fight Amir Khan is 'dead,' according to Bob Arum. 
MANILA, Philippines – There will be no face-off between Manny Pacquiao and Amir Khan anytime soon. 
This after Top Rank Inc. chief Bob Arum confirmed Wednesday that there is no deal to make the fight a reality. 
Speaking to ESPN.com’s Dan Rafael, Arum said Pacquiao’s adviser Michael Koncz, whom he had met earlier to discuss the fight, is about to relay the bad news to the Filipino icon. 
"Michael is on his way back to meet with Manny but it's kaddish for the UAE deal. It's dead," Arum told Rafael. 
"I'm talking to him about another proposal for another fight, not Khan. Khan won't be Manny's next opponent," he added. 
Koncz had spearheaded talks with an investment group from the United Arab Emirates that has reportedly dangled a $38 million fund for Pacquiao to face Khan in the country.   
Arum said that fight might still happen, but not on the planned May 20 date. 
"UAE would not happen until November, if it happens at all, but I doubt it will," said the veteran promoter. 
While Koncz worked on the UAE deal, Arum set his sights on Australia, sitting down with representatives of prospect Jeff Horn for a fight in Brisbane. Pacquiao, however, was keen on taking on Khan instead, effectively killing the negotiations with Horn’s people. 
Arum had been skeptical of the proposal from the UAE for a Pacquiao-Khan showdown, and he turned out to be true. 
“When they contacted me [about the Khan deal], I told them it was pie in the sky, that this is crazy, it’s not going to happen,” Arum said in a separate interview with Lance Pugmire of the Los Angeles Times. “Manny wanted to roll the dice. He rolled the dice and it came up snake eyes. 
“If something is too good to be true, it’s too good to be true,” he continued. 
Pacquiao went for Khan after the British fighter topped a Twitter poll put up by Pacquiao asking his followers who should he fight next. The other choices were Khan’s countryman Kell Brook, rising star Terence Crawford and Horn. 
Unfortunately for Pacquiao and his fans, they will not get what they want. 
“That deal is done for now. [Pacquiao and Koncz] were talking to the wrong people,” Arum also told the LA Times.
